title.rendered: Movistar, Orange and Vodafone lose customers

content.rendered:
Of the three big ones, Movistar Plus+ is the one that has had the worst results, while the other two companies have had somewhat smaller indentations.

Movistar Plus +, the one that loses the most customers

doing accounts, Movistar Plus + is the pay television platform that has fallen the most in Spain and the one with the most lost customers added to the aforementioned global. In total, more than 200,000 Movistar Plus+ paid subscribers have said goodbye to the platform in the last year.

Movistar Plus

This bleeding of television clients has increased during the first quarter of 2022, where another 70,000 clients have decided to unsubscribe. Currently, there are some 3,640,000 Movistar pay television subscribers. It is expected that miMovistar’s more customizable and affordable offer according to consumer tastes can revitalize the television sector and begin to win customers again.

In addition, for the next season, it has a strategic value with respect to its competitors. Thanks to an agreement with DAZN to be able to broadcast its five LaLiga matches each day (except for two of them that were already 100% exclusive to Movistar), it will be the only platform where the entire domestic competition can be seen today. Together with the rights to European competitions and miMovistar’s à la carte configurations, they can help achieve positive data from next season.

Vodafone and Orange have minor losses

Starting with the red operator, Vodafone closed its fiscal year (as of the end of March 2022) with losses of some 88,000 pay television customers. In this way, it would accumulate approximately 1.5 million clients right now. The company is also transitioning its business model, relying more on movies and TV series to grab subscribers, with deals such as being the platform offering HBO Max integrated exclusively.

Vodafone TV

Over the last two years, the English operator has focused on growing its audiovisual offer to become the most complete content aggregator in the country. It did so after verifying among its clients that there was really no interest in LaLiga and that the added value of including it was nil.

As to Orange, has lost some 35,000 paying customers on Orange TV, which represents 4.8% compared to the previous year. Your current subscriber count is 690,000 customers and is carrying out measures to revitalize its television offer, such as adding Rakuten as a partner for a new digital video store or offering Orange TV to customers with Go Top rates.

Video club Orange by Rakuten

However, the data has a trick, because only includes those users who connect to the television through the decoder. The reason is that, according to the requirements of the CNMC, Orange (like Telefónica) have to comply with a regulated price when closing the sale of football.

That is why they cast customer accounts in this way: “If we grow in pay television customers we would be increasing the bill that we have to swell at the end of the year at the cost level,” said Diego Martínez, general director of Orange B2C, in the presentation of the company’s results.
